Important Purpose Notice

This HRMO e-Logbook with Face Recognition System is specifically designed for tracking the time-in and time-out of office clients, visitors, and external stakeholders.

1. Acceptance of Terms

By registering your biometric data (facial features) and using the HRMO Client e-Logbook with Face Recognition ("the System"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Use. If you do not agree to these terms, you will not be able to use the biometric client logbook and must contact the HRMO for alternative manual logging procedures.

2. Purpose of the System

The System is implemented by the ASIST Human Resource Management Office (HRMO) for the specific purpose of:

  • Automating and securing client/visitor time-in and time-out logging at ASIST offices
  • Enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of client attendance records
  • Providing secure and contactless client identification and tracking
  • Streamlining administrative processes related to client visit monitoring
  • Maintaining accurate records of client office visits for security and administrative purposes
  • Improving service delivery through efficient client flow management

Note: This system is exclusively for tracking office clients, visitors, and external stakeholders. Employee attendance tracking is handled through separate systems.

3. Data Collection, Use, and Storage

3.1. Type of Data Collected

The System will capture and process your biometric data, specifically a digital template (a mathematical representation) of your facial features. It does not store actual photographs or video footage for logging purposes.

3.2. How Data is Used

Your facial template will be used solely for:

  • Verifying your identity when logging time-in and time-out at ASIST offices
  • Generating client visit reports for administrative purposes
  • Maintaining security records of office visits
  • Improving service delivery through visit pattern analysis (aggregated data only)

3.3. Data Storage & Security

  • Biometric templates are encrypted and stored on a secure server controlled by the ASIST HRMO.
  • Client visit data is retained for a maximum period of 2 years, after which biometric templates are permanently deleted.
  • Data is not shared with, sold to, or accessed by any third parties without your explicit consent, except as required by law or for legitimate institutional purposes.
  • We implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your biometric data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss.

4. User Consent and Rights

4.1. Voluntary Consent

Your provision of biometric data for client logbook purposes is voluntary. However, refusal to provide such data will necessitate the use of an alternative, non-biometric method of client logging as determined by the HRMO.

4.2. Right to Information

You have the right to be informed about how your biometric data is handled and to access your visit records upon request.

4.3. Data Deletion

You may request deletion of your biometric data at any time by submitting a written request to the HRMO. Upon such request, or after 2 years of inactivity, your biometric template will be permanently deleted from the active System, unless retention is required by applicable law or institutional policy.

4.4. Client-Specific Rights

As a client/visitor using this system, you have the right to:

  • Know what data is being collected about your office visits
  • Request correction of inaccurate visit records
  • Obtain a record of your office visits upon proper identification
  • Withdraw your consent for biometric data collection (alternative manual logging will be provided)

5. Client Responsibilities

  • You must use the System personally for your own time-in and time-out logging. Any attempt to log attendance for another person (e.g., using a photograph, mask, or proxy) is strictly prohibited.
  • You are responsible for positioning yourself correctly in front of the recognition device to ensure accurate reading during office visits.
  • You must immediately report any issues with the System (e.g., failure to recognize, hardware problems) to the HRMO or front desk personnel.
  • You must not attempt to tamper with, hack, or disrupt the System hardware or software.
  • You must use the system only for legitimate office visits to ASIST premises.
  • You should ensure that your facial features are clearly visible to the camera (removing hats, sunglasses, or other obstructions during registration and use).

6. Privacy and Data Protection

The HRMO complies with relevant data privacy laws including the Data Privacy Act of 2012 (Republic Act No. 10173). Our general Privacy Policy, which outlines your broader data rights, is available at ASIST Privacy Policy. Specific to biometric data, we adhere to stricter guidelines as outlined herein.

7. Prohibited Conduct

The following are strictly prohibited:

  • Registering another person's face or an object as your own.
  • Circumventing or attempting to circumvent the face recognition process.
  • Any action that compromises the security or integrity of the System.
  • Using the System for any purpose other than legitimate client time-in and time-out logging at ASIST offices.
  • Attempting to access other clients' visit records or system data.
  • Using the system to falsify visit records or office attendance.

8. Consequences of Violation

Violation of these Terms of Use may result in:

  • Revocation of your access to the biometric logbook system
  • Requirement to use alternative manual logging procedures
  • Restriction of access to ASIST premises in cases of serious violations
  • Reporting to appropriate authorities for illegal activities
  • Potential legal liability for damages caused to the system or institution

9. Limitation of Liability

ASIST and the HRMO will not be liable for any incidental, indirect, or consequential damages arising from the use or inability to use the System, including but not limited to technical failures, recognition errors, or delays in logging, except where such liability is mandated by law. The institution's liability shall be limited to cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct.

10. Changes to Terms

The HRMO reserves the right to modify these Terms of Use at any time. Changes will be communicated to registered clients via the ASIST website (www.asist.edu.ph) with reasonable notice. Continued use of the System after changes constitute acceptance of the new terms.
